tracks.title: Senior Release Architect â€“ Git & Delivery
tracks.summary: Design robust branching, release, and recovery strategies for real teams and monorepos.

quests.title: Branching & Environment Map
quests.summary: Map environments (dev, staging, prod) to branches and flows.
quests.objective: Produce a concrete branch/env map for a multi-service product, including rules for what merges where and who is allowed to do it.

quests.title: Release Train & Cadence
quests.summary: Define how changes move from PR to production over time.
quests.objective: Specify a release train (trunk-based or gitflow-inspired) including cut points, stabilization windows, and how releases are tagged and announced.

quests.title: Hotfix & Backport Flows
quests.summary: Design how you handle urgent fixes and backports safely.
quests.objective: Define a hotfix/backport workflow with concrete branches, commands, and rules for how fixes are merged forward and back.

quests.title: Monorepo & Multi-Service Strategy
quests.summary: Handle multiple services/modules in one repo without chaos.
quests.objective: Describe how you structure a monorepo, manage service ownership, and decide what gets versioned together vs separately.

quests.title: History Surgery & Recovery
quests.summary: Use rebase, revert, and bisect without corrupting shared history.
quests.objective: Propose a policy for rebases vs merges and outline playbooks for reverting bad changes and using git bisect in production incidents.

bosses.title: Timeline Release Arbiter
bosses.summary: Judges your end-to-end release, branching, and recovery strategy for a real team.
